value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Per User (Preview)
value.excerpt: Are you curious what Power BI Premium Per User is all about? Adam walks you through how to get it and what it means from a user experience. Take advantage of Power BI Premium features without the Premium capacity price!  Announcement Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-premium-per-user-public-preview-now-available/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dEgR2_xi3mw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Let's Talk Power BI Gateways
value.excerpt: Join us live as we talk about Power BI gateways! The what and why regarding them and some things to consider when using a gateway.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-onprem  Gateway monitor report: https://docs.microsoft.com/data-integration/gateway/service-gateway-performance
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/L49fk602Dzg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Migrate your Paginated reports to Power BI
value.excerpt: Are your paginated reports still on-premises with either Power BI Report Server or SQL Server Reporting Services? Want to move them to Power BI? Patrick shows you how you can do that using the RDLMigration tool!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/migrate-ssrs-reports-to-power-bi
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_VaBzheAgxY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Native Query: Be careful when using in Power BI
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at native query and why you should be careful when using it in Power BI. He looks at what native query is, what to consider when using it, and how to monitor what query folding, in Power Query, is or is not doing.  Guy in a Cube Courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT!
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/DWbh7xp08l0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: One Click Calculation Group in Power BI
value.excerpt: Calculation Groups in Power BI can be amazing! Patrick shows you how you can create these common patterns with just one click using Tabular Editor.  Blog: https://www.esbrina-ba.com/time-intelligence-the-smart-way/  Calculation Groups: https://docs.microsoft.com/analysis-services/tabular-models/calculation-groups?view=asallproducts-allversions

value.title: Tracing with Log Analytics and Power BI
value.excerpt: With Log Analytics integration in Power BI, you can now capture Analysis Services trace events easily and over a longer period of time. Combined with the Power BI template report, you can gain a lot of insights into usage of your datasets. With more to come down the road!  Announcing long-term usage

value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: You can take advantage of the R Script showcase to start using R Visuals with your reports. value.title: What the heck is USERPRINCIPALNAME in Power BI? (Row-Level Security)
value.excerpt: Ever wonder what USERPRINCIPALNAME is in DAX within Power BI? Or the difference between USERPRINCIPALNAME and USERNAME? Hint - It's used with Row-Level Security.  New Row-Level Security course from Guy in a Cube - https://guyinacu.be/courses  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Working with images in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to work with images in Power BI. He isn't talking about adding a logo into your report. This looks at how you can integrate visuals in your visuals based on your data.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Advanced Power BI Bookmark Options (Data/Display/Current Page)
value.excerpt: If you use Power BI Bookmarks you may not have used the advanced bookmarking options for  ➔ Bookmark Data ➔ Bookmark Display  ➔ Bookmark Current Page I talk about these options and show you were these can really help you out when using Power BI Bookmarks in advanced scenarios.  ================================

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present

value.title: Power BI Pivot: Move Data from Rows to Columns #Q&A
value.excerpt: I am a huge fan of Unpivot (moving data from Column to Rows), but sometimes Pivot is your friend, when you need to move data from Rows to Columns. If you're getting this error "There were too many elements in the enumeration to complete the operation. " trying to Pivot in Power BI, watch this video.

value.title: Generate Year Month Day Combinations in Power BI Report using Power Query Date ToText Function
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. Formats such as 2021 Jan, or Jan 2021, or even Jan 21, or 2021-01 are very popular. In Power BI, ideally, you should have a Date dimension with columns for this. However,

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. value.title: Previous Dynamic Period using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Parallel Period is a function that helps you fetching the previous period of a Month, Quarter, or Year. However, if you have a dynamic range of date, and you want to find the previous period of that dynamic selection, then Parallel Period can’t give you the answer. As an example; if the user selected
